p: Crushed powdered leaves of P. malayana (1 g) were subjected to extraction. The extraction was conducted by sonication. The powdered leaves were immersed in 30 mL of methanol–water at various ratios (0, 25, 50, 75, and 100%, v/v) and allowed to sonicate for 30 min. Subsequently, the extracts were filtered using Whatman filter paper No.1. A rotary evaporator was used at 40 °C to remove the solvent. To clear any residual solvents, the extracts were then freeze-dried and stored at −80 °C. For this study, a total of 20 samples were prepared (4 replicates for each of the 5 separate extracts).
